instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U8900: What is U8900? This chip creates the GPU power rails on the 820-3332 board to the 2012 and early 2013 15” Retina Macbook Pros. It becomes desoldered and is the cause of no video and kernel panics/crashes in that model most of the time..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_CPU: What is PPVCORE_S0_CPU? This is the primary power rail for the CPU that powers the CPU, known as CPU vcore. Without this, the machine will be braindead. .
definitions.PP1V05_S0:
What is PP1V05_S0? The PP1V05_S0 power rail is for various components on the logic board that require a 1.05V supply voltage in the S0 (on) state. This voltage rail is likely to be used by the CPU (for VCCIO), PCH (Platform Controller Hub).

.
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_AXG: What is PPVCORE_S0_AXG? This is vcore going to the CPU’s integrated graphics processor for CPUs that have an integrated GPU. When this is missing on a device that has an integrated GPU and no discrete GPU, it usually means either no screen is detected, or the GPU integrated into the CPU is dead..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> connects, but has no image or backlight, without thunderbolt and HDMI.
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 12.59v, <SIGNAL>PP5VR3V3_SW_LCD_UF</SIGNAL> 0v with connected LCD; PP1V5R1V35_GPU_REG_R oV with oscillation.

It already replaces the components <CHIP>U8900</CHIP>, <CHIP>U9100</CHIP> and <CHIP>U9000</CHIP> based on reading posts, but it remains the same, I need help to solve this mac. :)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> connects, but has no image or backlight, without thunderbolt and HDMI.
threads.message:
Do you get CPU voltages?
Did you test for USB activity?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> connects, but has no image or backlight, without thunderbolt and HDMI.
threads.message:
the USBs work, read the external MacOS, gives the sound of turning on, but without any image on the external and with an LCD that I'm sure works.
there are no signs of oxidation.

 Voltage CPU :
<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> 0.85V;  <SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0</SIGNAL> 1.05V ; <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_AXG</SIGNAL> 0.81V; 

already caught similar defect in macbook pro 15 2011 in the gpu, is that what it is?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> connects, but has no image or backlight, without thunderbolt and HDMI.
threads.message:
Looks like GPU issue, if no external video too.
On Internet exist few hardware mods to disable GPU; never tested yet for this kind of board...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> connects, but has no image or backlight, without thunderbolt and HDMI.
threads.message: Do you know any way to disable the gpu on this mac?if you can send a link to a video showing how you do it I appreciate it, I looked but I couldn't find it.
